result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin P Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin P Johnson not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor on behalf of Attorney Amanda J. Olsen in Court for Marvin P Johnson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1999, and Co-Defendant Case, 22CF1689. Clerk previously made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom from CJF; however, CJF did not have staff available to accommodate Court's request. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion for Joinder. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of trial posture. Statements made regarding Joinder. Defense did NOT object to State's Motion for Joinder. For reasons stated on the record, Court WITHHELD RULING on State's Joinder Motion. At this time, Mr. Johnson's cases (22CF1690 and 22CF1999) and Mr. Love's cases (22CF1689 and 22CF2000) will be set for trial on the same date. 

Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Joinder Motion. 2CF1689, 22CF1690, 22CF1999, 22CF2000; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen appeared by video for Marvin P Johnson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1999, and Co-Defendant Case, 22CF1689. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of trial posture. State advised the Court of MOTION TO JOIN ALL CASES. Defense objected. Court ordered State's Motion due on or before October 7, 2022; and Defense counsel's Response due on or before October 21, 2022. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. 
Scheduling Conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other case 22CF1999, and Co-Defendant's cases 22CF2000 and 22CF1689. Defendant and Attorney Kremer appeared Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. For reasons stated on the record, State requests a Status hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Clerk contacted the parties via email to reschedule Status/Scheduling Conference. 
NEW DATE: Status/Scheduling Conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:25 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Clerk provided information to MCSO.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss (Marvin P. Johnson - Milwaukee County Jail 949 N. 9TH ST. 3A CELL#18 MILWAUKEE, WI. 53233)

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with Attorney Amanda R. Kremer; both appear by video.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective N. Reaves. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed. 
Attorney Amanda Kremer

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in Court with Attorney Amanda R. Kremer as a friend of the Court. Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1999. Court reviewed OSPD Status of Counsel Report. Prior to the case being called on the record, Attorney Thomas Reed advised the Court that the Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for the Defendant. Discussion placed on the record. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Amanda Kremer to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in Court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1999. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Information provided to the Public Defender's Office. Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:45 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

<If the Public Defender's Office fails to appoint counsel by the next hearing, Court will appoint counsel at County Expense.>

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in Court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Indigency hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1999. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Defendant confirmed that he QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION AND REQUESTS REPRESENTATION. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. COURT TOLLED TIME LIMITS. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person for the the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Defendant refused SPD appointment in 22CF1999. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Matter is adjourned to the trial court.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  William Berens appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with NTJ, dob 4/9/1992 - RJW, dob 11/20/1989 - LRL, dob 10/4/1987 - EW, dob 12/23/2006 - LML, dob 5/18/1988 - KCM, dob
10/2/1990
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvin P Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 6.   Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
